thread.title: REVEALED: The winners of the DASLS Legal Awards 2017 | Devon Live
thread.title_full: REVEALED: The winners of the DASLS Legal Awards 2017 | Devon Live

title: REVEALED: The winners of the DASLS Legal Awards 2017 | Devon Live
text:
Comments (0) 
The winners of the DASLS Legal Awards have been announced. 
More than 350 members of Devon and Somerset's thriving legal profession attended the black-tie glittering gala dinner at Sandy Park, Exeter on Thursday night. 
The Military Wives Choir performed for guests and the evening was hosted by the BBC's legal expert and journalist Joshua Rozenberg. 
Mark Roome, President of the Devon and Somerset Law Society, said that the legal profession had a vital role to play in the uncertain post-Brexit landscape. 
He said: "Brexit will, I am sure, create an unprecedented and complex range of legal issues. 
It's inevitable, I would think, that the solicitor profession will be at the forefront of the transition into a post-EU era, and we need able and sensible legal professionals to offer the best legal advice possible, and provide a quality of service second-to-none. 
"There are many who will rise to the challenges ahead and it's those firms and those individuals that the Legal Awards look to celebrate." 
Read more: Who made the shortlist? 
The Legal Awards are organised by the Devon and Somerset Law Society in partnership with DC Media and and title sponsored by legal software development company Solicitors Own Software. 
It is an opportunity for the legal profession to recognise the contribution solicitors and law firms make to their local communities and the region's economy. The winners:
